newsitem.title: HONG KONG: RESEARCH ALERT - HK & Shanghai Hotels upgraded to buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - HK & Shanghai Hotels upgraded to buy.

text.p: ING Baring Securities (Hong Kong) Ltd said in a recent report it has upgraded Hongkong and Shanghai Hotels Ltd to a buy, based on the share's deep discount to its revised net asset value (NAV).
"Based on the existing valuation (HK$14,000 per sq ft), the stock is already trading at a 32 percent discount to our estimated NAV of HK$16.71," analyst Johnny Wong said in a report.
"Using current asking rents of about HK$52 per sq ft, the yield based on (revised) HK$18,800 per sq ft would be 3.3 percent, in line with current market yields," the report said.
Using the revised price of HK$18,800 per sq ft for the company's Repulse Bay properties, "our NAV will increase to HK$19.82," Wong said.
"Based on this NAV, Hongkong and Shanghai Hotels will be trading at a 42 percent discount," he said.
Wong is forecasting earnings per share of HK$0.84 in 1997 and HK$0.94 in 1998.
The share closed HK$0.15 higher at HK$12.00 on Monday.
